result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis Joseph Kain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 90 days jail, to be completed in the Wisconsin State Prison
Remit fines and costs- payment of DNA Surcharge= payable from available prison monies. DNA Sample Due: 7-28-2022.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

2:15 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Travis Joseph Kain in court, in custody.  Attorney David Moss in court for Travis Joseph Kain. 
Court calls cases 21CF309 and 22CM30.
Court informs of max penalties.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.

Court is being heard on corrections. 
DA has no corrections.

DA heard on recommendation and sentencing.
Atty heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposes on Count 1-21CF309: 5 Years IC, 5 Years ES, Consecutive to 22CM30 and any other sentence. 
Eligible for CIP and SAP after serving 2 years of IC.
300 days credit for time served. 
Conditions of Extended Supervision: 
Remit fines and costs- Payment of DNA Surcharge= Payable from available prison monies. 
No possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substance without a valid Rx, and only with prior agent approval. 
No contact with known drug users or sellers, unless in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval. 
Maintain/obtain full time employment. 
Any other assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. 
DNA Sample Due: 7-28-2022. 
Court imposes on Count 1- 22CM30: 90 days jail- to be completed in the Wisconsin State Prison.

records.addlTxt:
2:57 PM Defendant Travis Joseph Kain in court, in custody.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney David Moss in court for Travis Joseph Kain. 
Court calls cases 21CF309 and 22CM30.
DA spks on testimony for today's hearing. 
DA calls witness- Officer Francour Sworn in and examined. 
Witness identifies Deft. 
Atty Moss cross examines. 
Both parties rest. 
ADA provides argument on Motion to Suppress. 
Atty Moss provides argument on Motion to Suppress.
Court denies Motion to Suppress Fruits of Illegal Search and Seizure. 
3:36 PM

08:31 AM Defendant Travis Joseph Kain in court with attorney David Moss.  Defendant Travis Joseph Kain in custody.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Travis Joseph Kain appeared by video means with Attorney.
Court calls cases 21CF309 and 22CM30. 
Atty is being heard- deft no longer wishes to enter a plea, requests trial. 
DA is being heard- requests initial appearance on 22CM30. 
INIT on 22CM30:
Atty is being heard- criminal complant has been reviewed. 
Deft understands.
Waives formal reading. 
Enters not guilty plea. 
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties. 
Deft understands. 
Court inquires on hearing both cases.
Atty spks- requests separate trials. 
Parties agree to a 2 day trial on 21CF309.
All proposed motions, proposed verdicts, and jury instruction to be submitted no later than end of business day on May 19th, 2022. 
Atty requests substantive motions to be filed by April 4th, 2022. 
DA to respond by April 18, 2022. 
Court schedules with parties. 
08:48 AM

  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Copy of comp.

Deft no objection.
Court sets $100 cash bail w/conditions:  sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid RX, no contact with CO Michalski, except in professional capacity.
